alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 11:26PM CDT until March 26 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC005-251630- /O.CON.KOUN.FL.Y.0007.000000T0000Z-230327T0000Z/ /CANO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 1126 PM CDT Fri Mar 24 2023 ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, The creek reaches bankfull levels in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. High stages on small feeder streams could further result in greater-than-bankfull overflows to mainstem bottomlands. Croplands... pastures... and some secondary rural roads along and near Clear Boggy Creek are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 24.6 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 25.6 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
